comment.author: 35607158@N06
comment._content: This giant paper-making machine is known as a Fourdrinier  invented, oddly enough, not by Fourdrinier but by Louis-Nicolas Robert. Pictured is the so-called dry end of the machine, the wet pulp having entered from the wet end.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content:
Wow, thanks!  That really helps explain how this whole thing works.

Doug
